name: Asociación de Empresas de Energías Renovables
goal:
APPA is the most representative Spanish Renewable Energy (RES) Association grouped in 9 different sections representing all kind of RES technologies (biofuels, biomass, wind energy, geothermal energy, marine energy, small wind, small hydro, solar photovoltaic, self-consumption).
Constituted in 1987, APPA today counts 330 members (RES & biofuel producers, financial entities, consultancies and others RES sector associations). With an active presence in Spain and in Europe, APPA Renewables advocates a comprehensive view of all renewable technologies.

APPA's main objetives are threefold: To carry out lobbying vis-à-vis national and European institutions, to provide legal and technical advice to its members and to provide them specific sector information in a consistent manner.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
RES-Electricity, RES-Heating &Cooling, RES-Transport.
Clean Energy Package; Trilogue Red II
